summary: "The Silmarillion" is a book of myths and stories written by J.R.R. Tolkien, edited by his son Christopher. It tells about the fictional universe of Eä, which includes places like Valinor, Beleriand, Númenor, and Middle-earth. The book has five parts: the creation of Eä, descriptions of powerful beings called Valar and Maiar, the history of the First Age and the Silmarils (jewels), the downfall of Númenor, and the story of the Rings of Power. It was inspired by various mythologies, like Finnish and Greek legends. Although it was well-received commercially, scholars had mixed reviews due to its complex editing process.
title: The Silmarillion
